data.title: Bel Air High School

data.text:
Welcome to Bel Air High School.

731 N. Yarbrough

El Paso, Texas 79915

915-434-2000

A Legacy of Loyalty and Spirit: Bel Air High School

"Opened in 1957, Bel Air High School stands as a testament to the enduring traditions that have shaped generations. With colors that proudly display the vibrant Red and Blue, the spirit of unity and determination is woven into every aspect of the school's fabric. The distinctive Hamilton Red Tartan represents not only a pattern but a symbol of the strong bonds that connect the students and community.

Motto: 'Loyal Forever' encapsulates the unwavering dedication that students, alumni, and faculty have exhibited throughout the years. Just as the Wooden Highlander, Tam Oâ€™Shanter, stands tall with a sense of history and pride, so do the Highlanders of Bel Air High School, embracing their past as they stride towards the future.

The stirring Bel Air Fight Song, a rallying cry that echoes through the halls, captures the essence of the school's spirit. 'Hail the Highlanders of Bel Air High,' it proclaims, honoring the relentless efforts of those who strive for excellence. From Freshmen to Seniors, united under the banner of 'Do or Die,' they exemplify the spirit of resilience and unity. With each note of the fight song, the wearers of Red and Blue are reminded of their tried and true spirit, igniting the fire of determination within.

As we embark on a journey through the history and traditions of Bel Air High School, let us remember the echoes of the past, celebrate the present, and march forward with the same resounding cheer: 'Oh, fight, you, Bel Air Fight, you Highlanders, Fight!'"

Bel Air's Fight Song

Hail the Highlanders of Bel Air High,

Hail the efforts: they of Do or Die,

Freshmen, Sophomores, Juniors, Seniors (Ex's!)

Fight, Fight, Fight!

Hail the wearers of Red and Blue,

Hail their Spirit: it is Tried and True,

Oh Let them hear; Give a Rousing Cheer,

Oh, fight, you, Bel Air Fight, you Highlanders, Fight!

Our programs and extracurricular activities are second to none.

Fine Arts

Fine Arts, English Literature, or World Language

Band, Dance, Choir, Guitar, Orchestra, Theatre, Spanish, and French

Multidisciplinary

Four credits in advanced placement, IB or dual credit selected from English, Mathematics, Science, Social Studies, Economics, Languages Other Than English, or Fine Arts

Health Professions

Health Science, Anatomy and Physiology, Clinicals, Dental Assistant Program, Emergency Medical Technician, Licensed Vocational Nurse, Pharmacy Technician Program, Physical Therapy, Veterinary Science, Medical Terminology, and Practicums in Health Science, Correctional Services, Law I and II, and Forensic Sciences

Business & Industry CTE

Law Enforcement, Principals of Law, Correctional Services, Law I and II, Forensic Sciences, Practicum in Audio/Video Productions, Business Management & Administration, Principles of Audio & Video, Animation, Fashion Design, Graphic Design, Business Information Management I, Business Management, Advertising, Practicum in Marketing

STEM

Engineering - PLTW, Principles of Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Computer Science, and Civil & Architecture Engineering

Extracurricular Activities/Sports

Award-Winning Percussion Ensemble

Western United States Grade IV Pipe Band

Bel Air "BIG RED PRIDE" Marching Band

Bel Air Jazz

The state-of-the-art Bel Air Athletic Complex, which houses the Carroll Dibler Gymnasium, was recently completed and features 98,000 square feet of space with dedicated areas for basketball, volleyball, gymnastics, wresting and dance.
